name: The Providence Biltmore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient to Federal Hill , The Arts District and Shopping - For the price this hotel is a great deal
reviews.title: I always stay here when I get to Providence

reviews.text: I find it to be clean, comfortable and safe
reviews.title: Beautiful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and professional
reviews.title: Grand Dame is aging gracefully

reviews.text: There is a spa but I have never used it
reviews.title: Feels like it might still be 1978

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a Starbucks connected to the hotel
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Well situated, a large, old, grande dame sort of palace with large rooms and corridors. Comfortable beds. A bit old style and slightly neglected. Off site parking inconvenient. Close to Amtrak.
reviews.title: Worth Another Visit

reviews.text: You will be treated well. Free wireless which is great in today's world. The lobby is amazing with details in the ceiling and woodwork. The rooms however are outdated with a lack of outlets, older tv etc. Bed was comfortable. My two nights there was quite a but of street Josie heard through the window and I was on an upper floor
reviews.title: Beautiful and friendly but old rooms

reviews.text: Outstanding location, great room, wonderful onsite restaurant (McCormick & Schmick's... plus a lovely Starbucks). Walking distance to Providence Mall, State House, Amtrak and downtown. Hotel is historic, and has minor signs of aging (but don't we all?). We have stayed at nearby Westin and Renaissance -- both were excellent hotels, but next time we'll pick the Biltmore again.
reviews.title: Great location -- classic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am originally from RI and always thought of the Biltmore a very nice hotel. I recently stayed there for a wedding and was extremely disappointed. The lobby is pretty and the rooms are adequate, but the service was terrible. The front desk was not friendly at all and it took close to 25 minutes to get our car even when we called from the room 5 prior to leaving. I would not return to this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: The room we got felt like a palace compared to many hotels. 2 king beds in the bedroom and a huge living room. Room was very clean and nice. Valet parking seemed pricey for Providence. Would have given it 5 stars otherwise.
reviews.title: We loved the size of the room. Very clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at The Biltmore on August 20 and filled out the e-guest survey on August 22 but haven't heard anything, so I thought I'd put my comments here...
reviews.title: Poor Service

reviews.text: I reserved a Premium King Suite over the phone. The reservationist was excellent and requests that I mentioned (high floor) had been noted and were mentioned when I arrived at the hotel.
reviews.title: Quick get away

reviews.text: Upon check-in, we were given keys and sent to two rooms that were still dirty. The first room had not been visited by a housekeeper at all (I wasn't sure if someone was still staying in the room, from the quick look I had). We understand that mistakes are made and returned to the front desk. The front desk manager gave us keys to a second room, and when we arrived found the housekeeper was still working in the suite. It was embarrassing to return to the front desk for a second time to report that this room was, also, not ready. The front desk manager did give us two drink vouchers for the inconvenience, which was appreciated. The third room was clean except for an unemptied garbage can (there was a rotting banana peel in the garbage). The room had one towel for two guests and I had to call 4 times before additional towels were delivered (at least 2 hours after the first call). By the time the towels arrived, I'd already used a hand towel instead of a bath towel, since I had to get ready for a dinner engagement.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: The staff were all courteous and the lobby is very lovely. The hotel's location is great and the building adds great character to the city. While our suite could do with some renovations, it had a certain charm, and I wouldn't hold this against the hotel.
reviews.title: Reminiscent of a bygone era

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I very much wanted to love the hotel but, with so many service issues during a one night stay, I would probably not return on my next visit to Providence.
reviews.title: So disappointed!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed in two junior suites. Great king beds and a comfy pullout sofa. We also had a two year old who adopted the large walk-in closet as his "room". Worked out great because we could close the door when he went to bed and not have to worry about waking him up! Close to Providence place, some great restaurants, and the river! Rooms were clean, a little dated, but overall..very nice!
reviews.title: Great location for waterfire!

reviews.text: It's 1 am. We are hungry, but we are making due with crackers from the airplane trip and a soggy peanut butter and jelly sandwich. We also managed to raid our 2.5 year old's Cheerios. Here is an account of what happened.
reviews.title: Room service never came and I'm hungry!

reviews.text: We had a very long trip from the West Coast with a 2.5 year old and a 9 month old and looked forward to getting to the hotel and ordering room service before going to sleep. At 10:45 pm, we ordered some New England clam chowder, a wedge salad, a New England Lobster roll and some linguini with tomato sauce for the 2.5 year old. Sounds yummy, doesn't it? That would have cost about $46 without the additional 20% service charge.
reviews.title: Wonderful base for Waterfire

reviews.text: We think that it's coming any second and then we end up calling at 12:30 am. Of course, they don't know anything about it, apologized and acted annoyed about the situation. They did ask what I could think of to make it better, but with the kitchen closed, I am out of ideas. We are here for 3 additional days but will not be ordering room service.
reviews.title: A nice stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By the way, I did learn that the next time I order room service, I'm not going to watch the Food Network while I wait.
reviews.title: Its age shows

description: In the heart of downtown, steps from the City's most exclusive shopping and dining areas and conveniently located near the Convention Center, and Providence Place Mall.The Providence Biltmore offers personal attention and comfort appealing to both leisure and business travelers. A welcoming alternative to more commercial branded hotels, the Biltmore provides an atmosphere to that of a grand European hotel.
